page.title: 05Horton Priory Sellindge 1900
page.content: In 1912, Horton Priory was purchased by Mr.J.J.Cairnes who had made his fortune from gold mining,cattle and shrewed investments in America.By this time the building was in poor repair and he spent much money restoring it and adding an East Wing on the probable site of the original church and cloisters.In 1940 the building was commandeered by an anti-tank regiment for defence against invasion by the German army.The house became the officers residence until 1944 when it was returned to Mr.Cairnes and his family.In 1950 Mr.Cairnes died and left the property to his daughter who by now had married Brigadier Gore.They are now the only residents of Horton Priory which is their private home and is not open to the public.Many of the architectural features of this house are felt to be unique.
